Summarizing cTWAS results

Kaixuan Luo, Sheng Qian

2024-06-19

Source: vignettes/summarizing_ctwas_results.Rmd
summarizing_ctwas_results.Rmd

In this document, we will show how to summarize and visualize cTWAS results.

Load the packages.

library(ctwas)

We also need gene annotations from the Ensembl database. We use EnsDb.Hsapiens.v86 for the example data, please choose the Ensembl database for your specific data.

library(EnsDb.Hsapiens.v86)

Load the cTWAS results

# GWAS sample size
gwas_n <- 343621
# Load weights
weights <- readRDS(system.file("extdata/sample_data", "LDL_example.preprocessed.weights.RDS", package = "ctwas"))


# Load region_info, snp_info and LD_info
region_info <- readRDS(system.file("extdata/sample_data", "LDL_example.region_info.RDS", package = "ctwas"))
snp_info <- readRDS(system.file("extdata/sample_data", "LDL_example.snp_info.RDS", package = "ctwas"))
LD_info <- readRDS(system.file("extdata/sample_data", "LDL_example.LD_info.RDS", package = "ctwas"))

# Load cTWAS results
ctwas_res <- readRDS(system.file("extdata/sample_data", "LDL_example.ctwas_sumstats_res.RDS", package = "ctwas"))
param <- ctwas_res$param
finemap_res <- ctwas_res$finemap_res
boundary_genes <- ctwas_res$boundary_genes
z_gene <- ctwas_res$z_gene
region_data <- ctwas_res$region_data
screened_region_data <- ctwas_res$screened_region_data

# directory with computed correlation matrices
cor_dir <- system.file("extdata/sample_data", "cor_matrix", package = "ctwas")

Assessing parameters and computing PVE

We could use the summarize_param() function to assess the convergence of the estimated parameters and to compute the proportion of variance explained (PVE) by variants and genes.

ctwas_parameters <- summarize_param(param, gwas_n)
# Estimated prior inclusion probability
ctwas_parameters$group_prior
##   expression|liver expression|adipose                SNP 
##       0.0112258728       0.0032677115       0.0002253614
# Estimated prior effect size:
ctwas_parameters$group_prior_var
##   expression|liver expression|adipose                SNP 
##         159.366028         159.366028           4.889058
# Estimated enrichment of molecular traits over variants:
ctwas_parameters$enrichment
##   expression|liver expression|adipose 
##           49.81275           14.49987
# PVE explained by molecular traits and variants:
ctwas_parameters$group_pve
##   expression|liver expression|adipose                SNP 
##       0.0021346173       0.0007335085       0.0005839915
# Total heritability (sum of PVE)
ctwas_parameters$total_pve
## [1] 0.003452117
# Attributable heritability
ctwas_parameters$attributable_pve
##   expression|liver expression|adipose                SNP 
##          0.6183502          0.2124807          0.1691691

Make convergence plots of estimated parameters

make_convergence_plots(param, gwas_n)

 

Summarizing cTWAS results

To interpret and visualize the results, we first need to add gene annotations (gene names and gene types) to the finemapping result.

We need a user defined data frame gene_annot that should contain the following columns: ‘chrom’, ‘start’, ‘end’, ‘gene_id’, ‘gene_name’ and ‘gene_type’ for each gene or molecular trait.

If you only used gene expression data, you can use the following function to obtain the gene annotations from the Ensembl database.

ens_db <- EnsDb.Hsapiens.v86
finemap_gene_res <- finemap_res[finemap_res$type!="SNP",]
gene_ids <- unique(sapply(strsplit(finemap_gene_res$id, split = "[|]"), "[[", 1))
gene_annot <- get_gene_annot_from_ens_db(ens_db = ens_db, gene_ids)

We then use anno_finemap_res() function to add gene annotations to the finemapping result, and use gene mid-points to represent gene positions.

# add gene annotations and use gene mid-points to represent gene positions
finemap_res <- anno_finemap_res(finemap_res, 
                                snp_info,
                                gene_annot,
                                use_gene_pos = "mid")
## 2024-06-19 19:04:33 INFO::Annotating ctwas finemapping result ...
## 2024-06-19 19:04:34 INFO::add gene_name and gene_type
## 2024-06-19 19:04:34 INFO::use gene mid positions
## 2024-06-19 19:04:34 INFO::add SNP positions from snp_info

Interpreting cTWAS results

We list all molecular traits with PIP > 0.8, which is the threshold we used in the paper.

# select gene PIP > 0.8
sig_finemap_res <- finemap_res[finemap_res$type!="SNP" & finemap_res$susie_pip > 0.8,]
head(sig_finemap_res[order(-sig_finemap_res$susie_pip),])
##     chrom      pos            gene_id gene_name      gene_type
## 220    16 72070235  ENSG00000261701.6       HPR protein_coding
## 233    16 72057824  ENSG00000257017.8        HP protein_coding
## 200    16 56972848 ENSG00000087237.10      CETP protein_coding
##                                                     id       type context
## 220                 ENSG00000261701.6|expression_Liver expression   liver
## 233  ENSG00000257017.8|expression_Adipose_Subcutaneous expression adipose
## 200 ENSG00000087237.10|expression_Adipose_Subcutaneous expression adipose
##                  group          z            region_id susie_pip      mu2
## 220   expression|liver -18.403150 16_71020125_72901251 1.0000000 474.3442
## 233 expression|adipose  -4.810203 16_71020125_72901251 1.0000000 420.6018
## 200 expression|adipose  13.749840 16_55869862_57630418 0.9999615 149.3997
##     cs_index
## 220        1
## 233        3
## 200        1

When we have multiple contexts (e.g. tissues) or types (e.g. expression, splicing), it is useful to evaluate the combined PIP for each gene by contexts, types, or groups. We could further limit results in credible sets and/or protein coding genes.

# combine gene PIPs by context
combined_pip_by_context <- combine_gene_pips(finemap_res, 
                                             by = "context",
                                             filter_protein_coding_genes = TRUE)
head(combined_pip_by_context)
##     gene_name combined_pip liver_pip adipose_pip
## 24       CETP        1.026     0.026       1.000
## 55        HPR        1.000     1.000       0.000
## 54         HP        1.000        NA       1.000
## 139    ZDHHC7        0.368     0.006       0.362
## 148    ZNF689        0.106     0.106          NA
## 9       BCKDK        0.093     0.093          NA
# combine gene PIPs by type
combined_pip_by_type <- combine_gene_pips(finemap_res, 
                                          by = "type",
                                          filter_protein_coding_genes = TRUE)

# combine gene PIPs by group
combined_pip_by_group <- combine_gene_pips(finemap_res, 
                                            by = "group",
                                            filter_protein_coding_genes = TRUE)

# select combined PIP > 0.8
sig_gene_pips_df <- combined_pip_by_context[combined_pip_by_context$combined_pip > 0.8, ]
head(sig_gene_pips_df)
##    gene_name combined_pip liver_pip adipose_pip
## 24      CETP        1.026     0.026           1
## 55       HPR        1.000     1.000           0
## 54        HP        1.000        NA           1

Visualizing cTWAS results

We could make locus plots for regions of interest. We could zoom in the region by specifying the locus_range.

If we want to show the correlations with the focus gene, we need correlation matrices of the region. Because we have computed and saved correlation matrices during fine-mapping step, we could simply load those precomputed correlation matrices.

cor_res <- get_region_cor(region_id = "16_71020125_72901251", cor_dir = cor_dir)
make_locusplot(finemap_res,
               region_id = "16_71020125_72901251",
               weights = weights,
               ens_db = ens_db, 
               R_snp_gene = cor_res$R_snp_gene,
               R_gene = cor_res$R_gene,
               locus_range = c(71.6e6,72.4e6),
               highlight_pip = 0.8,
               legend.position = "top")
## 2024-06-19 19:04:35 INFO::focus gene: HPR
## 2024-06-19 19:04:35 INFO::focus id: ENSG00000261701.6|expression_Liver
## 2024-06-19 19:04:35 INFO::plot locus range: chr16 71600000,72400000
## 2024-06-19 19:04:36 INFO::HPR liver expression QTLs
## 2024-06-19 19:04:36 INFO::QTL positions: 72063820,72063928
